title: Coroner identifies man accused of shooting Randolph Co. deputy
content:
RANDOLPH COUNTY, AL (WBRC) -
The Randolph County Coroner released the identity of the man who took his own life after authorities say he shot a deputy.
The coroner identified him as 76-year-old Eli Lee, of Wedowee. ALEA State Trooper Gary Daniel says a suspect shot the deputy around noon on Saturday.
The incident ended with the suspect dying from a self-inflicted gunshot wound.
The deputy was discharged from the hospital Saturday night.
ALEA's State Bureau of Investigations is investigating the shooting, customary with shootings involving law enforcement. The findings of the investigation will be turned over to the Randolph County District Attorney's office.
